result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity: Arraignment

Activity: waiver of prelim

03:28 PM Defendant Eric Deangelo Carter in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Philip J. Brehm also appearing by video.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of complaint to attorney, reading waived.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:01 PM Defendant Eric Deangelo Carter in court by video in custody with attorney C. James Fitzgerald by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $10,000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim L.J.K., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of weapons.
